title: Amazon SageMaker Ground Truth vs Amundsen: Which data governance Tool is Better in 2026?
metaDescription: Compare Amazon SageMaker Ground Truth vs Amundsen. See pricing, features, pros & cons to choose the best data governance tool for your needs in 2026.
introduction: Choosing between Amazon SageMaker Ground Truth and Amundsen for your data governance needs? Both are popular tools in the AI space, but they have different strengths, pricing models, and use cases. This comprehensive comparison breaks down the key differences to help you make an informed decision.

sections.title: Overview: Amazon SageMaker Ground Truth vs Amundsen
paragraphs: Amazon SageMaker Ground Truth is Amazon SageMaker Ground Truth is a fully managed data labeling service that helps build highly accurate training datasets for machine learning. It provides built-in workflows, access to human labelers through Amazon Mechanical Turk, third-party vendors, or your own workforce, and uses active learning to automate labeling and reduce costs. It uniquely integrates directly with the SageMaker ecosystem for end-to-end ML development and offers advanced features like automatic 3D point cloud labeling and adjustment workflows.. It's known for aws, data-labeling, training-data.

Amundsen, on the other hand, is Amundsen is an open-source data discovery and metadata engine originally developed by Lyft. It provides a centralized search and catalog interface for data assets (tables, dashboards, streams) across an organization, enabling users to find, understand, and trust data. Its key capabilities include automated metadata ingestion, data lineage visualization, and usage-driven ranking, uniquely focusing on improving data productivity and reducing time spent searching for data.. Users choose it for data-catalog, metadata-management, data-lineage.

sections.title: Pricing Comparison
paragraphs: Amazon SageMaker Ground Truth pricing: paid.
When it comes to value for money, consider your specific use case and team size.

sections.title: Features & Capabilities
paragraphs: Amazon SageMaker Ground Truth excels in: Built-in labeling workflows for image, text, video, and 3D point cloud data, Access to a managed workforce (Mechanical Turk, third-party vendors, or private teams), Automated labeling using Active Learning to reduce manual work by up to 70%. This makes it ideal for teams that need aws.

Amundsen stands out with: Automated metadata ingestion from sources like Apache Atlas, AWS Glue, and databases, Search interface with ranking based on usage patterns (e.g., frequent queries, popularity), Column-level lineage tracking to visualize data flow and dependencies. It's particularly strong for users focused on data-catalog.

sections.title: Use Cases: When to Choose Each Tool
paragraphs: Choose Amazon SageMaker Ground Truth if: You need aws, work with data-labeling, or require flexible pricing.
Choose Amundsen if: You prioritize data-catalog, work in metadata-management, or prefer their pricing model.

sections.title: Pros & Cons
paragraphs: Amazon SageMaker Ground Truth Pros: Verified platform, Highly rated (4.4/5), Extensive feature set.
Amazon SageMaker Ground Truth Cons: Paid plans may be needed for full features.
Amundsen Pros: Verified platform, Highly rated (4.4/5), Comprehensive features.
Amundsen Cons: May have feature limitations.

verdict: Both Amazon SageMaker Ground Truth and Amundsen are solid choices for data governance. Your choice depends on your specific requirements: Amazon SageMaker Ground Truth is better for aws, while Amundsen excels at data-catalog. Consider trying both with their free tiers or trials to see which fits your workflow better.
